name: James_Packard
text:
James Packard
James Packard was the founder of the Packard Sawmill.
Biography
Packard was the eldest son of a Boston shipping family and attended Harvard and Yale.
After being inspired by a vision, he traveled west with his wife Unguin, with the intention of settling in Seattle, Washington. They soon decided to instead settle in Twin Peaks, where Packard founded the Packard Sawmill in the late 1880s.
By 1922, management of the mill had been passed down to Packard's son, Thomas Packard.
